instructions: Stivinn Aura November 5, 2011 at 1:57 am Rakshak, you can not delete files that are attributed 'System' by default, eg. the Nokia Ringtone. For all other files, you may delete them from the file's menu itself, or try using an app like File Explorer or Blue FTP ( http://gallery.mobile9.com/f/2176759/?ref=2994 , http://gallery.mobile9.com/f/2185978/?ref=2994 ) to navigate to the file and delete them. FIDELIS November 4, 2011 at 11:03 pm Hello, you could try navigatigating to file you want to delete. Once you find it, click on it and keep your finger pressed on the file, wait a few seconds until the options appear and select delete. If the file can not be deleted for some reason trying the steps discussed in the following thread: http://discussions.nokia-asia.com/t5/Cseries/c3-is-Not-able-to-delete-downloaded-videos-from-fone-memory/td-p/780039
